DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee On Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary urinary bladder cancer based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the pathologic T stage of a bladder tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.longName: Bladder
Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/9/17 tt transferred context/BC; added Reg Status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Bladder Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of bladder cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer in which there is no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer in which there is no evidence of a primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading subepithelial connective tissue. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading subepithelial connective tissue. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the muscularis propria. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the muscularis propria. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the superficial muscularis propria (inner half).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT2a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the superficial muscularis propria (inner half).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the deep muscularis propria (outer half).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT2b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the deep muscularis propria (outer half).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the perivesical tissue. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading the perivesical tissue. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with microscopic invasion into the perivesical tissue. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with microscopic invasion into the perivesical tissue. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor macroscopically invading the perivesical tissue (extravesical mass).  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor macroscopically invading the perivesical tissue (extravesical mass).  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading any of the following: prostatic stroma, seminal vesicles, uterus, vagina, pelvic wall, abdominal wall. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading any of the following: prostatic stroma, seminal vesicles, uterus, vagina, pelvic wall, abdominal wall. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Bladder Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Bladder Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading prostatic stroma, uterus, vagina.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading prostatic stroma, uterus, vagina.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with a finding of noninvasive papillary carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pTa TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with a finding of noninvasive papillary carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ: 'flat tumor'. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ: 'flat tumor'. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading pelvic wall, abdominal wall. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Bladder Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Bladder cancer with tumor invading pelvic wall, abdominal wall. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
